Special Powers
CONSTRUCTS: Immediately KO this Construct if it is not within 6 squares of the character that generated it. // Constructs do not block line of fire, do not require opposing characters to break away, and opposing characters don't stop moving when they become adjacent to a Construct. Constructs can't be chosen for Mastermind or have their combat values modified by other characters.
THIS BOOT AIN'T MADE FOR WALKING: FREE: Knock back an adjacent opposing character 6 squares if it has [Tiny symbol], 4 squares if it has [Standard symbol] or 2 squares if it has [Giant symbol].

Thunderwebs
[QUOTE=pokolo;12132208]a logical errata would be "modified by other sources" anyone who tries to tell you this can't use CCE is a jerk... just play it until wizkids says otherwise (they will fix it though)[/QUOTE] As a judge since Armor Wars in 2005, that's how I would rule it. The Green Spotlight has ESD, so this isn't an isolated case but an oversight in the restrictions on Constructs.

March 24, 2021
Dortmuner
Well, pending the inevitable errata or clarification, you have the same source (the card) telling you two different things. So you have to decide which to go with. Did WK accidentally put a power on the dial that the Construct can't use or did WK write the Construct rule regarding modifying values poorly and it means values cannot be modified by anything other than the Construct itself? It seems to me the judge or the house would need to rule on it until we get clarification. If someone feels strongly RAW is clear as it is and it means it cannot use its own CCE, so be it. I'm of the opinion that WK probably didn't put a power on a card that it couldn't actually use. YMMV
